conclusion: Analyze relative motion using v-t graph to determine collision.
Car's initial speed is 30 m/s, truck's speed is 10 m/s, initial distance is 30 m.
Car's speed decreases over time on the v-t graph.
At t=1s, car's speed is approximately 20 m/s.
At t=5s, car's speed is approximately 10 m/s.
Calculate car's distance from t=0 to t=1s as 25 m.
Calculate car's distance from t=1 to t=5s as 60 m.
Total distance traveled by car from t=0 to t=5s is 85 m.
Truck travels 50 m from t=0 to t=5s.
Calculate relative distance after 5s as -5 m.
The car and the truck will collide.
